Package gg.w6.chesslib.util

Class Positions

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.util.Positions
public class Positions extends Object
A utility class providing static methods for analyzing chess Position states.

This class contains common operations such as determining if the king to move is in check, whether a square is targeted by a specific color, and generating the vision of rider pieces based on their movement capabilities and obstructions.

This class is not instantiable.

  • Method Details

    • isKingToMoveInCheck

      public static boolean isKingToMoveInCheck(@NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      Determines whether the king of the player whose turn it is in the given Position is currently in check.

      This method is useful for legal move generation.

      Parameters:
      position - the current position to evaluate
      Returns:
      true if the king to move is in check, false otherwise

    • getRiderVision

      @NotNull public static @NotNull List<Coordinate> getRiderVision(@NotNull @NotNull Rider rider, @NotNull @NotNull Coordinate originCoordinate, @NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      Returns a list of coordinates that the given Rider piece can "see" from its origin, taking into account board boundaries and blocking pieces.
      Parameters:
      rider - the Rider piece to evaluate
      originCoordinate - the starting coordinate of the rider
      position - the current board position
      Returns:
      a list of coordinates representing the rider's line of sight

    • isTargetedByColor

      public static boolean isTargetedByColor(@NotNull @NotNull Coordinate target, @NotNull @NotNull Color targeterColor, @NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      Determines whether the specified target square is attacked by any piece of the given targeterColor in the provided Position.
      Parameters:
      target - the square being checked for targeting
      targeterColor - the color of the attacking pieces
      position - the current board position
      Returns:
      true if the square is targeted, false otherwise

    • getEnPassantTarget

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Coordinate getEnPassantTarget(@NotNull @NotNull Position position, @NotNull @NotNull Move move)
      Return the En Passant target square Coordinate for a Position that results from making the given Move after on the given position. Naturally, this only is non-null if the move is a double pawn push.

      This method is generally useful for parsing a FEN string and generating a position from it.

      Parameters:
      position - the position before the move is made.
      move - the move that is being made.
      Returns:
      the En Passant Square coordinate for the resulting position.

    • isCheckmate

      public static boolean isCheckmate(Position position)
      Determine if the supplied Position is checkmate.
      Parameters:
      position - the Position to check for checkmate
      Returns:
      true if the Position is checkmate, false otherwise.

    • isStalemate

      public static boolean isStalemate(Position position)
      Determine if the supplied Position is stalemate.
      Parameters:
      position - the Position to check for stalemate
      Returns:
      true if the Position is stalemate, false otherwise.

    • getTargetingCoordinates

      public static List<Coordinate> getTargetingCoordinates(@NotNull @NotNull Coordinate target, @NotNull @NotNull Color targeterColor, @NotNull @NotNull Position position)
      Returns a list of all coordinates from which pieces of the specified targeterColor are attacking the given target square in the provided Position.

      This includes:

      • Rider pieces (e.g., rooks, bishops, queens, knights, kings) that can reach the target square through their movement patterns without being blocked.
      • Pawns that can capture the target square diagonally.
      • Pawns that can perform an en passant capture onto the target square, if applicable.
      Parameters:
      target - the square being checked for attacks
      targeterColor - the color of the attacking pieces
      position - the current board position
      Returns:
      a list of coordinates from which the target square is being attacked
